entries.description: Start a boom game. Call this from your own game script
entries.name: boom

files.file_description: It is heavily inspired by the Kaboom.js game framework.
files.file_summary: Boom is a game framework built on top of Defold.

params.description: Anchor (center, topleft, left, topright, right, bottomright, bottom, bottomleft)
params.name: anchor

files.file_description: Use this component to offset any rendered component such as a SpriteComp from the center of the game object.
files.file_summary: Anchor component.

entries.description: This will create an area component which is used to describe an area which can collide with other area components.
entries.name: area
entries.summary: Create a collider area and enabled collision detection.

entries.name: get_collisions
entries.summary: Get all collisions currently happening for this component.

entries.name: check_collision

params.description: The game object to check collisions with.
params.name: GameObject

returns.description: Return true if colliding with the other object
returns.name: bool

entries.summary: Check collision between this component and another object.

entries.name: on_collide

params.description: Optional tag which colliding object must have, nil for all collisions
params.name: tag

params.description: Function to call when collision is detected
params.name: cb

entries.summary: Register event listener when this component is colliding.

entries.name: on_click
entries.summary: Register event listener when this component is clicked.

entries.name: has_point

returns.description: Will return true if point is within area
returns.name: result

entries.summary: Check if a point is within the area of this component.

files.file_description: Use this component to define a collider area and bounds for a game object. The area can be either a rectangle or a circle. The size can either be set manually or based on the size of a renderable component, such as a sprite.
files.file_summary: Area component.

entries.description: Requires AreaComp and PosComp components on the game object. This also makes the object solid.
entries.name: body
entries.summary: Physical body that responds to gravity.

entries.name: is_grounded
entries.summary: If the body is in contact with ground.

entries.name: is_falling
entries.summary: If the body is falling (velocity is pointing down).

entries.name: is_jumping
entries.summary: If the body is jumping (velocity is pointing up).

entries.name: jump_force
entries.summary: The upward velocity applied to the body when jumping.

entries.name: is_static
entries.summary: If the body is static and not affected by gravity.

files.file_summary: Component to control the color of the game object.

entries.name: double_jump
entries.summary: Performs double jump (the initial jump only happens if player is grounded)

files.file_summary: Fade in game object visual components such as sprites.
Make object unaffected by camera.

entries.name: on_heal
entries.summary: Register an event that runs when heal() is called.

entries.name: on_hurt
entries.summary: Register an event that runs when hurt() is called.

entries.name: on_death
entries.summary: Register an event that runs when health is 0 or less.

files.file_summary: Handles health related logic.

files.file_description: Use this component when you need a game object to be destroyed after a period of time.
files.file_summary: Destroy the game object after certain amount of time.

params.description: Speed of movement in pixels per second.
params.name: speed

files.file_summary: Component to move a game object in a direction of travel and at a specific speed.

entries.name: on_exit_screen

params.description: Function to call when the object goes out of view
params.name: cb

entries.summary: Register a callback that runs when the object goes out of view

entries.name: on_enter_screen

params.description: Function to call when the object enters view
params.name: cb

entries.summary: Register a callback that runs when the object enters view

files.file_summary: Control the behavior of a game object when it goes out of view
files.usage:
-- move towards a direction infinitely
local projectile = add({
    sprite("bullet"),
    pos(player.pos),
    move(vec2(0, 1), 1200),
    offscreen({ destroy = true })
})

entries.name: opacity
entries.summary: The opacity of the component instance.

files.file_summary: Component to control the opacity of a game object.

entries.name: move
entries.summary: Move a number of pixels per second.

files.file_summary: Position of a game object.
Rotate a gameobject

entries.description: Apply a scale to the object
entries.name: scale

files.file_summary: Scale a gameobject

params.description: Which animation or image to use
params.name: anim

entries.name: flip_x
entries.summary: If sprite should be flipped horizontally

entries.name: flip_y
entries.summary: If the sprite should be flipped vertically

files.file_summary: Render as a sprite.

entries.name: stay
entries.summary: Do not get destroyed on scene switch.

files.file_summary: Do not destroy the game object on scene change.
Render as text

entries.name: timer
entries.summary: Run certain action after some time.

entries.name: wait
entries.summary: Run a callback function after n seconds

entries.name: loop
entries.summary: Run a callback function every n seconds

files.file_summary: Run an action once or repeatedly at a set interval

entries.description: Object will be drawn on top if z value is bigger.
entries.name: z
entries.summary: Determines the draw order for objects.

entries.name: on_collide

params.description: Tag which the first game object must have
params.name: tag1

params.description: Optional tag which the second game object must have
params.name: tag2

entries.summary: Register an event that runs when two game objects collide.

entries.name: on_key_press

params.description: The key that must be pressed or nil for any key
params.name: key_id

entries.summary: Register callback that runs when a certain key is pressed.

entries.name: on_key_release

params.description: The key that must be released or nil for any key
params.name: key_id

entries.summary: Register callback that runs when a certain key is released.

entries.name: is_key_down

params.description: The key that must be down, or nil for any key
params.name: key_id

entries.summary: Check if a certain key is down.

params.description: Optional click on object with tag filter
params.name: tag

params.description: Callback when mouse button is clicked
params.name: cb

entries.name: on_mouse_press
entries.summary: Register callback that runs when left mouse button is pressed.

entries.name: on_mouse_release
entries.summary: Register callback that runs when left mouse button is released.

entries.name: on_mouse_move
entries.summary: Register callback that runs when the mouse is moved.

entries.description: Register an event that runs every frame, optionally for all game objects with certain tag
entries.name: on_update

params.description: Run event for all objects matching tag (optional)
params.name: tag

params.description: The event function to call. Will receive object and cancel function.
params.name: fn

entries.name: add

params.description: The components for the game object
params.name: comps

entries.summary: Add a game object with a set of components.

entries.name: add
entries.summary: Add a game object as a child of this game object.

entries.name: is

returns.description: Returns true if the tag exists on the game object
returns.name: result

entries.summary: Check if there is a certain tag on this game object.

entries.name: use
entries.summary: Add a component to this game object.

entries.name: unuse
entries.summary: Remove a component from this game object.

entries.name: c

params.description: The component to get state for
params.name: tag

entries.summary: Get state for a specific component on this game object.

entries.name: destroy
entries.summary: Destroy a game object and all of its components.

entries.name: destroy_all

params.description: The tag to destroy or nil to destroy all objects
params.name: tag

entries.summary: Destroy all objects with a certain tag.

entries.name: object

returns.description: The object or nil if it doesn't exist
returns.name: string

entries.summary: Get game object with specific id.

entries.name: get

params.description: The tag to get objects for, nil to get all objects
params.name: tag

entries.summary: Get all game objects with the specified tag.

entries.name: every

params.description: The tag that must exist on the object
params.name: tag

entries.summary: Run callback on every object with a certain tag.

params.description: The angle to set or nil to get current rotation
params.name: angle

entries.name: cam_zoom

params.description: The zoom to set or nil to get the current zoom.
params.name: zoom

entries.summary: Get or set the camera zoom.

returns.description: The gravity in pixels per seconds
returns.name: gravity

entries.name: add_level

params.description: List of strings presenting horizontal rows of tiles
params.name: map

returns.description: Game object with tiles as children
returns.name: level

entries.summary: Construct a level based on symbols.

entries.description: If called with no arguments the function returns a number between 0 and 1. If called with a single argument 'a' a number between 0 and 'a' is returned. If called with two arguments 'a' and 'b' a number between 'a' and 'b' is returned.
entries.name: rand

entries.description: Create Color from a hex string.
entries.name: from_hex

params.description: Hex string in RGB, RGBA, RRGGBB or RRGGBBAA format (with optional initial #).
params.name: hex

files.file_summary: Color in RGBA format.

entries.description: The transition will happen over a certain duration using a specific easing function.
entries.name: tween

params.description: Time in seconds to go from start to end value
params.name: duration

params.description: Function to call when the value has changed
params.name: set_value

entries.summary: Tween a value from one to another.

params.description: The function to call when the tween has finished
params.name: fn

files.file_summary: Vector type for a 2D point (backed by Defold vmath.vector3())

params.description: Id of the scene to show
params.name: id

params.description: Additional arguments to pass to the scene function

entries.name: wait
entries.summary: Run a callback after a certain nummber of seconds.

entries.name: loop
entries.summary: Run a callback repeatedly with a certain interval
